title: POWER RAILS in order to turn it on the mac help
message: I am a Litle confused  because I see the POWER RAILS but I don know which has to be present before and after turning on the machine I know  some voltage is Always-Present but which one not?

title: POWER RAILS in order to turn it on the mac help
message: G3H rails are always present. S5 rails are present with AC connected. The rest will come on as the macbook turns on first S4 then S3 and last S0. Once S0 is present the very last voltage will be CPU Vcore to come high.

title: POWER RAILS in order to turn it on the mac help

Thanks for your answer I ask these because I have one Mac book pro 820-2532 I have PP3V3 S5 but I don’t have PP5V S5 and both came from the same IC but I don have short to ground in the coil L7220 and I don’t know if I have to make another post for these question?

title: POWER RAILS in order to turn it on the mac help
message: L7220 is the 5V power supply and is a S3 rail. Common problem on these boards is C7771. What is the voltage on C7771? Are you using a REAL Apple 85W charger?

title: POWER RAILS in order to turn it on the mac help
message:
L3405 burned because of a short in the cable to the airport card or airport card in LCD they plugged it in upside down. L3405 has no effect on the power on of the board.

SMC_ADAPTER_EN present? Green light present?

title: POWER RAILS in order to turn it on the mac help
message: Yes I have SMC_ADAPTER_EN 3.3v and Read Ligth Present what other signals I have to check  and how I have  know the signals What I have to follow  In pc is easy to me I check the signals in KBC I know there what I have to do but apple is totally different  I am a little confused

title: POWER RAILS in order to turn it on the mac help
message: PM_PWRBTN_L toggling when you press the power button? PP3V3_G3_RTC present? 32kHz present on Y2810?

title: POWER RAILS in order to turn it on the mac help
message: MCP is now a primary suspect, SMC is next. I assume you checked all rails for shorts?
